org.gradoop.storage.hbase.impl

Class HBaseEPGMStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.storage.hbase.impl.HBaseEPGMStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, EPGMConfigProvider<GradoopHBaseConfig>, EPGMGraphInput, EPGMGraphOutput, EPGMGraphPredictableOutput<HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMGraphHead>,HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMVertex>,HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMEdge>>

    public class HBaseEPGMStore
extends Object
implements EPGMConfigProvider<GradoopHBaseConfig>, EPGMGraphInput, EPGMGraphPredictableOutput<HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMGraphHead>,HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMVertex>,HBaseElementFilter<org.gradoop.common.model.impl.pojo.EPGMEdge>>
    Default HBase graph store that handles reading and writing vertices and graphs from and to HBase.
    See Also:
    EPGMGraphPredictableOutput

    • Constructor Detail

      • HBaseEPGMStore

        public HBaseEPGMStore(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Table graphHeadTable,
                      org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Table vertexTable,
                      org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Table edgeTable,
                      GradoopHBaseConfig config,
                      org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Admin admin)
        Creates a HBaseEPGMStore based on the given parameters. All parameters are mandatory and must not be null.
        Parameters:
        graphHeadTable - HBase table to store graph data
        vertexTable - HBase table to store vertex data
        edgeTable - HBase table to store edge data
        config - Gradoop Configuration
        admin - HBase admin instance

      • dropTables

        public void dropTables()
                throws IOException
        First disable, then drop all three tables.
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

      • truncateTables

        public void truncateTables()
                    throws IOException
        First disable, then truncate all tables handled by this store instance, i.e. delete all rows.
        Throws:
        IOException - when truncating any table fails.
